dialogues.text: Hopper’s out looking, a bunch of people are, but... Joyce fights back tears. Returns to the photographs. Jonathan sits down beside her and looks over the photogra They have been artfully taken by him over the years. Ther a photo of Will building a sand castle... riding a raft.. eating a hotdog at Coney Island... visiting the city... Jonathan fights back tears. His voice emerges low, choked

dialogues.speaker: JONATHAN
dialogues.text: ..-.I’m sorry.

dialogues.speaker: JOYCE
dialogues.text: Sorry? What’re you sorry for? Jonathan says nothing. Doesn’t feel he needs to. Joyce takes his hand. Squeezes it.

dialogues.speaker: JOYCE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hey. This wasn’t your fault, baby, you hear me? You hear me? Jonathan averts his gaze.

dialogues.speaker: JOYCE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: He’s gonna come home soon. I know it. I know it... because I feel him. I feel him in my heart. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  60.

dialogues.speaker: JOYCE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: He’s close. He’s close. You believe me, Jonathan, right? Jonathan finally looks at his mom. And nods. Joyce smiles faintly. She holds up a pair of photographs, in each hand. Will on the raft. Will at Coney Island.

dialogues.speaker: JOYCE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What do you think? Jonathan considers. Chooses Coney island.

dialogues.speaker: JONATHAN
dialogues.text: I... I always liked this one. Joyce smiles softly.

dialogues.speaker: JOYCE
dialogues.text: +.-Me too. An emotional beat. Then: The kitchen phone BLARES TO LIFE. Joyce and Jonathan look up sharply. News.

dialogues.speaker: MOMENTS LATER
dialogues.text: Joyce grabs up the phone. Her voice tense, strained.

dialogues.speaker: JOYCE
dialogues.text: Yes -- hel--hello? There is no answer. But she can hear the sound of LOW BREATHING on the other end.

dialogues.speaker: JOYCE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Lonnie...? Hopper...? Still no answer.

dialogues.speaker: JOYCE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Who is this? Jonathan stands up. Getting worried now. The SOUND OF BREATHING grows louder. JOYCE CONT’D) Who is this?! Answer me! At last we hear a voice. It sounds very far away. It is the voice of a boy. Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  61.

dialogues.speaker: DISTANT VOICE
dialogues.text: .--Mom... Joyce pales. Tears rush to her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: JOYCE
dialogues.text: Will?!! will?!! Jonathan races over to his mom.

dialogues.speaker: JOYCE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Where are you, baby?! Talk to me!

dialogues.speaker: WILL
dialogues.text: But Will’s voice is now gone. In its place... Another voice. GUTTURAL. INHUMAN. Shifting in pitch.

dialogues.speaker: BABY
dialogues.text: Silence. Then -- A HIGH-PITCHED SHRIEK ERUPTS FROM THE RECEIVER. Joyce gasps in pain and drops the phone. She looks at her hand. Her palm is seared and her arm hair is standing straight up. She backs away from the phone. Her eyes wide with dread. Jonathan grabs up phone. His voice shakes.

dialogues.speaker: JONATHAN
dialogues.text: Who is this?! WHO IS THIS?! But the phone line is now dead. Joyce slumps down to the floor. She begins to sob.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Barbara stumbles out onto the beach. Her face is pale and blood pours from her nose and ears. She crashes to a halt. Looks around for help. Desperate. Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  62. But there is no bonfire. No kids. No party. Yet somehow, impossibly, she can hear the sound of music, of kids talk laughing. Only it all sounds far away. Like a distant mem A dense fog has drifted in from the Atlantic and the wave roll in slowly, much slower than normal, as if the world moves at quarter speed. The wet sand is covered in more o those strange, throbbing growths, and the sky is shrouded dark clouds. Electric blue lighting flashes, streaking th sky, and -- Barbara hears something. Something wet. Guttural. She turns. And pales. Obscured beneath the fog: A HORDE OF SHADOWED FIGURES. TALL. DISFIGURED. One of them walks on all fours. They are coming this way. Coming for her. She screams. And...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHOOSH! Our boys bike onto “Mirkwood.” They scan the trees. Calling out:

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Will?! WILL?!

dialogues.speaker: DUSTIN
dialogues.text: I’ve got your Uncanny! 269! There is no response but the chirp of cicadas. They bike on in silence for a little while. Lucas grows impatient.

dialogues.speaker: LUCAS
dialogues.text: Why are we even here? My mom says there’s a whole search party --

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: But they don’t know Will, and he doesn’t know them. He knows us. Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  63.

dialogues.speaker: LUCAS
dialogues.text: So?

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: So what if he’s scared and --

dialogues.speaker: RACING ACROSS THE PAVEMENT
dialogues.text: Mike’s eyes shoot wide -- he spins the wheel to the left Too fast -- he loses control -- skids -- Dustin and Lucas crash into him -- They all tumble -- and -- WHOOM! SLAM INTO PAVEMENT. They roll to stop. Dirt coughs.

dialogues.speaker: LUCAS
dialogues.text: ..-What... what was that? Mike? Mike doesn’t respond. Instead, he climbs to his feet, tur around, and looks back at the darkened road behind them. The SHADOWED FIGURE is standing there. Staring right at h Mike is wide-eyed. Scared. Slowly, very slowly, he raises flashlight and aims it at the figure. The beam illuminate A young girl. Bald head. Wild eyes. Fish ‘N Fry T-shirt. ELEVEN. She looks at Mike. He looks at her. Their gaze holds a beat. And then... A LOW GROWL RUMBLES. Mike hears it. He looks up at the night sky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joyce and Jonathan hear it too. They look out the window with tear stained eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hopper’s radio crackles to life. Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca  64.

dialogues.speaker: CALLAHAN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: (filtered ) You hear that Chief? Hopper doesn’t respond. His eyes fixed on the sky. We follow his gaze. RISING UP... Over his head... AND UP... Over Camp Hero base... AND UP... Over the shadowed trees... AND UP... To the dark silhouetted clouds in the sky above. A LOW GROWL RUMBLES, just like in the opening scene. But time, it grows louder, and louder, shaking our eardrums. An ELECTRIC BLUE light flashes behind the clouds. The storm is no longer coming. It’s here.

dialogues.speaker: END EPISODE
dialogues.text: Script provided for educational purposes. More scripts ca
